abstract: The director Pedro Almodóvar discusses his new film "The Skin I Live In."
snippet: The director Pedro Almodóvar discusses his new film "The Skin I Live In."
lead_paragraph: The director Pedro Almodóvar goes below the surface with his latest film, "The Skin I Live In." The movie, which played at the New York Film Festival and opens Friday, involves a plastic surgeon (Antonio Banderas) and a special woman in his life, Vera (Elena Anaya). Their relationship is complex, to say the least. In her review, Manohla Dargis describes the film as "an existential mystery, a melodramatic thriller, a medical horror film or just a polymorphous extravaganza." In this video, Mr. Almodóvar talks about how skin factors into the narrative. He also discusses reuniting, after 21 years, with the actor Antonio Banderas for the project.
